intro: Diphasium alpinum, commonly known as the alpine diphasium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its biennial growth cycle. The plant produces two distinct types of flowers—showy, showy flowers in the first year and smaller, more inconspicuous flowers in the second year. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils.
